body_html:
Not sure if that the original docstring is correct. Nor that this PR fixes anything; more likely that it restricts the behavior of tf.layers.dense. the current behavior is: input is [a, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10 output is: [a, b, c, ..., 10] (here a, b, c, ..., need not be known at graph build time) this PR seems to break that guarantee.
…

body_text:
Not sure if that the original docstring is correct.  Nor that this PR fixes
anything; more likely that it restricts the behavior of tf.layers.dense.

the current behavior is:

input is [a, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10

output is: [a, b, c, ..., 10]

(here a, b, c, ..., need not be known at graph build time)

this PR seems to break that guarantee.

body:
Not sure if that the original docstring is correct.  Nor that this PR fixes
anything; more likely that it restricts the behavior of tf.layers.dense.

the current behavior is:

input is [a, b, c, ..., m], and num_units = 10

output is: [a, b, c, ..., 10]

(here a, b, c, ..., need not be known at graph build time)

this PR seems to break that guarantee.
